entries.meaning: A beat that runs beneath a piece of music.
examples: It certainly had merit as a punkish shouter with its machine-gun-spatter underbeat.

verbs.description: underbeat (third-person singular simple present underbeats, present participle underbeating, simple past underbeat, past participle underbeaten)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To beat too little, or less than usual.
examples: At high elevations above 3.000 feet: Raise the baking temperature about 25 degrees. Underbeat the eggs.
